author: Rajiv Tangri
title: Why Should I Choose Cardano?
description: How do you get entrepreneurs to develop on Cardano?

assessments.note:
I think there are already too many videos (channels) if someone just types "Cardano" into youtube, so I think marketing would be much more than 2k, to be the most searched, or displayed. 

The time frame is not very detailed, the goal is to "create a channel with news to Cardano and its positive impacts" - I think there is much work that has to be done, to provide a better picture how to achieve it, and how to obtain increased proposers.
There are already loads of youtubers and dedicated News pages. Most of the youtuber don't need funding from catalyst but they are building a community from scratch...
While this YouTube channel may bring some awareness to Cardano, it is unclear how it is directing viewers to submit high impact proposals.

I like the idea itself. The proposal itself might be a bit too raw, pure PR forcing. In my eyes if I would like to target enterpremeurs and developers to join Cardano a transparent overview about full capabilities, advantages and disadvantages, ecosystem high level overview and a short training materials would the first steps. Technical facts could be much stronger convincing factor for devs. Main language with subs would be sufficient, majority of people targeted with this knows some level of English, the subtitles could do the rest. Purpose of bots might be out of scope, personally I think it is a bit offensive, I would rather tackle it with some way of feedback survey.

Such a channel is generally a good idea. What makes it a bit difficult is the fact that there already us quite a lot of social media coverage of Cardano and it would really need a new interesting angle and high quality videos to be seen through the noise. If that can be done, it will sure attract some new people to Cardano, especially if it puts in the effort to subtitle the news in many languages.
It is not clear how this will target proposers

Currently a large number of Youtube videos with substantial viewership exits. The effectiveness of those videos has enabled Catalyst to have exponential growth in the last six months or so. Therefore the incremental benefits of additional information videos on Youtube are not certain.

The proposal posits a very important challenge, I.e. how to get entrepreneurs to build on Cardano, however, the proposed solution seems off-key or rather unfocussed as it steered more towards a news channel offered in multiple languages. The proposal does not articulate well how the offering of the YouTube channel in multiple languages can directly reach 'entrepreneurs' who are looking for protocols to build on. It does sound more like a general information channel. The solution is further confused by the mention of 'incentives' to attract builders. The mechanism of this incentivization is not mentioned again in the document.
This proposal acknowledges the challenge by addressing a position that individuals outside of catalyst and the community could interface with aspects of it.

The problem statement doesn't describe a problem, it just rephrased the challenge question. There is no clarity in the solution statement. I recommend modifying these descriptions so that they communicate the idea of the proposal more easily.

The idea is to create a marketing campaign through videos on Youtube, but there is no plan for how this will attract entrepreneurs. The proposal is still a draft and needs to be better structured

The metrics described are not solid and do not indicate potential impact on the challenge.

The goal established at 12 months is unrealistic, reaching 1,000,000 subscribers is a difficult goal and there is no plan information that demonstrates how this goal will be achieved, in addition, a large number of subscribers is a KPI that alone cannot measure the success of the proposal for this challenge.

The proposal meets the challenge's objectives well, as it promises to clarify the Cardano project and its positive points for people outside the community, through a channel on youtube, specifically aimed at attracting more members. In other words, I believe that the possible results relate very well to what is intended, making the proposal very interesting and relevant.
This would certainly increase attraction towards cardano, and create a good outreach

This proposal is somehow aligned with the challenge but not completely. The creation of a/some YouTube channel(s) to give information about Cardano in general does not directly increases the number of proposers in Catalyst. It might have some increase due to this initiative, but such channels would aim into public in general. This challenge is intended to focus mainly on the proposers, so content should be specific to this audience somehow. I believe that the proposal could be remodeled for the next Fund with proposers in mind.

very low information about the person, a sample of a video would be nice, to see his skill in this area.  I think that most of the time will take just to hire people to help out to make this project happen than is estimated.

The proposer says in the comments that he doesn't have much time because of sports. But he has another proposal next to this (Fund the masses). I like the effort and motivation but I think maybe it is a little to much work. There is no mention about a team or people that help out so far.
For anyone claiming to have more than 1 million subscribers per channel, I would expect to see a link to an existing YouTube channel that is at least in the hundreds of thousands of subscribers.

Seems that the proposer has enough experience, even tough the headcount overview isn't transparent. The budget broke down is given, as well time plan, it could be realized. The question is the quality of the content, maybe that is even more important to measure the content quality rather than amount of subscribers.

While it will be quite difficult to get a million subscribers in such a timeframe and to produce several regular videos in 6 languages at a constant rate, with some söight modifications (e.G. subtitles in the required languages instead of actual video duplicates in those languages) the project might have a good outreach, maybe not as high as set but still good.
No evidence is given on how the proposer can make a channel in 6 languages or build up an audience of 1 million followers.

The proposers have limited experience in content creation or they have not referenced materials created by them. Without verifying established capability it is difficult to assess that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The proposer lists background and experience pertinent to the project. This proposal would benefit greatly if links to authored/produced education materials or videos is provided in order to validate the claims. The breakdown of the cost for each activity is provided but lacks details that would help paint a better picture of the activities, e.g. what social media channels will be utilised, how will the marketing seek the entrepreneurs who are looking to build, and what content will be produced. This proposal will benefit from explaining how a multi-language YouTube channel will run, whether as a subtitled/dubbed single video or multiple videos done in the different languages. Marks were given for success metrics however a target of 1million subscribers per language channel seems quite high. Charles himself only has a little more than 150k subscribers so an information channel targeted to those unfamiliar with Cardano may only get 10% of his numbers. I do hope I am wrong.
This proposal is a working roadmap. However, it is very lite on substance.

The team declared experience in creating videos, but did not provide any link or information to support this claim, there are no details about the team members and their qualifications. I recommend including more information that demonstrates the aptitude to create a marketing campaign and the experience in creating / editing videos.

There is no solid plan (there are no details on how to implement the proposal, there is no clear roadmap). There is a budget breakdown, but the absence of a solid plan makes it difficult to understand the feasibility of the requested budget.
The proposer seems to have video editing skills. But no word on experience growing an audience or managing social networks.

The author of the proposal claims to be Stake Holder, professor and creator of audiovisual content, that is, he has the basic knowledge to carry out the project. However, I believe that this idea needs a larger and plural team, people who work directly in marketing, in social media, to help give visibility to the channel ... Some members from within the community to explain better about Cardano's work, it would be interesting also some designers for the creation of digital arts that would help in interacting with the public (this is a suggestion, actually!). Therefore, I believe that the author is competent for the action, but requires the formation of a team.
Being a video maker is a plus, would have better to know the marketing skills

The proposer seems to have experience in teaching and it is relevant for the creation of a YT channel and better explain Cardano's principals, goals and news. Although, it doesn't mention how many people are involved with this project so far. If channels will be created in all languages, at least 5 more people are needed, and also it mentions the creation of a AI bot to answer audience questions, but this alone could be a single proposal in another area, depending on the level of details, and it would need people with very specific skills which the proposal don't mention if there someone already onboard or if they will start looking for someone. Also, the budget for AI creating doesn't seem to be enough for the desired development, it should be increase of the limitations of this AI should be mentioned.

I did not find any metrics on how to assess efficiency and feasibility. Also, I believe, that having channels or videos as a final product is very tricky. It can definitely help out to reach more people, but we (almost) never know, how much impact it had.

The proposal is really short which makes it again hard to assess. The roadmap and the milestones are only one sentence. I'd love to see a risk assessment from the proposer maybe for the next fund. 1 million subscriber on youtube are quite hard to reach within one year.

1 million subscribers per channel (or even combined) seems out of reach with this team within one year.

IOHK's YouTube channel has less than 70k subscribers. No (english-speaking) established crypto YouTube channel comes even close to 1 million at this point.

Big news YouTube channels like Los Angeles Times (~450k), Boston Globe (~50k), or even Democracy Now! (<890k) has that subscriber base. And they've been around a lot longer, have a bigger budget, and know what they are doing.

As written above, it isn't clear how effectively it addresses the challenge. Another aspect is that from community point of view how many people share, retweet and gets convinced by the content, joins the movement and spreads the words afterwards is the key measurement parameter.

The proposal lacks information of what the content if those videos should actually be, which makes it difficult to assess how effective it will be towards the challenge, as it would need a certain uniqueness to attract many new people.
More information is required on why is is feasible to expect the proposer to create a you tube channel with 1 million subscribers across 6 langauges,
The proposal is clear and brings out a clear scheme for implementation. However, the effectiveness of information videos on attracting new proposers can not be established clearly.

Given time (12 months) and $10000 a YouTube channel can be produced quite easily. The difficult part of this project is to attain the level of success aimed for. There is enough in the proposal to suggest some measure of success can be achieved (even 1k subscribers is already a huge win if they are legitimately entrepreneurs) so the main question is, which of the metrics will be used to indicate the $10000 is well spent? One can say that 10k is a lot to create a YouTube channel while another can claim that the same amount is not enough to build a news network. To sway the proposal from one view to another, greater detail needs to be added in order to provide a=better clarity of what is being funded.

I believe that more particulars would be needed before true success could be assessed.
example:
- What are the values that will link these videos, youtubers, teachers? How do we attract the right entrepreneur for the needs of the communities we serve?
- What is the minimum production value we must attain? Who is vetting people?

This proposal strikes me as requiring more work.

There is a budget breakdown and goals, but the goals are not good indicators for evaluating performance. There are no details about the team, there is no clear roadmap, there are no milestones, there are no KPIs.

The information described does not indicate elements to allow an efficient audit. I recommend that this information be included in accordance with the Catalyst documentation.
There is a timetable and a breakdown of the budget that can be used o track the project.

Included are the specific costs of each part of the project, such as expenses with advertising campaigns and the creation of artificial intelligence to interact on youtube. Goals are also set according to time periods (measured in months), which makes community monitoring much more possible. In other words, the project seems well planned, structured, and conveys certainty as to the steps that will compose the whole, even including the expectations of probable results.
Measuring the success from a youtube channel should have been addressed in the proposal

The proposal has goals for 3, 6 and 12 months, but more information about milestones, roadmap and KPIs should be included. The frequency of videos created, their release dates, for how long this work will be done, etc. Also, KPIs about how many people would be reached (not only 1M viewers after 1 year per channel), where it would be advertised, etc. These are all very important information to include here to make it possible to audit the proposal after it's funded.
